DOC.HEAD: Former Chief Judge in Virgin Island Dies
DOC.TEXT: David V. O'Brien, chief judge of the U.S. District Court in the Virgin Islands, died in Washington where he was undergoing treatment for Hodgkin's disease. He was 57. O'Brien had been head of the Virgin Islands court since 1988 and had been a member of the court since 1981. Prior to joining the bench, he had been a lawyer in the Virgin Islands and in New York, where he also was a journalist. A graduate of the University of Vermont and Syracuse University, he served in the Marine Corps during the Vietnam War. O'Brien died Friday at Georgetown University Hospital.
